website_summaries.verdict: A great option for buyers looking for heavy-duty gloves with excellent warmth and breathability.
pros: Thermacore insulation keeps hands supremely warm
2-layers of breathable fabric for excellent comfort
Outside zippered pocket to hold heater and other items

customer_reviews.title: Not warm enough
customer_reviews.text: This is designed with an inner and outer glove. Inner glove wants to stick to outer glove when pulling hand out or putting hand in. Wore in low 30s weather and finger tips became very cold. To be fair I have a problem with that in most gloves. Seem to be windproof.
customer_reviews.author: tonermd

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, hands were warm for multiple 10-30°F days
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, hands were warm for multiple 10-30°F days without using the liners. The liners that come with the gloves are hard to use, the grip pads are too sticky and make it difficult to put the gloves on with the liners on. They were a little tight and it was hard to move my fingers for the first day, but after a day or so of use they loosened up and were pretty comfortable. The wrist strap is key, no worries about losing these on the lift!
customer_reviews.author: Dhinson

customer_reviews.title: I've never torn gloves like this skiing or anything like that so have to ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear size medium for everything. I bought these in medium and they don't fit with the 2 pairs together. And after wearing them 3-4 times (and not doing anything physically demanding) the seam is starting to tear. I've never torn gloves like this skiing or anything like that so have to assume these are poorly constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Simonoff

customer_reviews.title: Like hand mobility; if so don't buy these?
customer_reviews.text: If there was a way too large option I'd select that. If you like about to lose about 33% use of your hands buy these gloves. One of the worst conceptualized designs ever created. Alone, the liner gloves are cool for driving or keeping your hands warm when the temperature is around 30 degrees, but because of the rubber gripping, sheer vast oversized nature, and extremely tight opening it is nearly impossible to put the gloves on over the liners. Epic waste of product and money. Lucky for me it wasn't a total waste because I have Northface gloves to use the liner with. Throwing the external gloves in the trash. Don't waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.author: AB77

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a glove
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with these gloves. The gloves themselves are very soft on the inside, comfortable, and legitimately warm. The lining gloves that come with them are also good for semi-cold weather. The lining gloves also have a grip texture on the palm and fingers. The only thing that would make these gloves better is if they could interact with my smart phone.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Standard for Burton - Warm and Useful
customer_reviews.text: Pretty standard for what I'd expect from Burton. These are warm ski/snowboard gloves. They are not lightweight and do not have high dexterity. Very good for their intended purpose. One note: The insulated outer gloves seem true to fit, and work fine on their own. For me, to wear these with the liners that come with them, I'd need another size up. But again, to me they don't need the liners. Tested to -20F so far and stayed warm. I will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: PQ

customer_reviews.title: don't buy this glove
customer_reviews.text: Useless. Could be the worst gloves I've owned as far as dexterity is concerned. Difficult to pull the velcro strap from one glove with the other glove on. Not very warm. The under glove will come off when you take off the over glove or sometimes stay on. The iPhone touch feature does not work.
customer_reviews.author: surfgilgo

customer_reviews.title: Very nice gloves but...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for 6'4" man with big hands, they kept his hands very warm during -14 weather. The only drawback was the opening of the Outer glove is very tight and impossible to get into without help. They do work on touchscreen phones and the liners kept his hands warm down to about 20 Degrees. If they weren't so hard to get into I would give them the full 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: LadyKane

customer_reviews.title: According to the measurement guide I should get a large so I bought extra large and I can’t even get them over my hand apparentl
customer_reviews.text: According to the measurement guide I should get a large so I bought extra large and I can’t even get them over my hand apparently you need to buy two sizes bigger I am returning
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Warm and grippy!
customer_reviews.text: Warmest pair of gloves I've ever worn. Liner is warm enough for all but bitterly cold/extended outdoor days. Liner has sticky plastic for superior grip (looks like the sticky gloves football players use, just not entirely covering the palm/finger surface). The main glove is a little bulky but can't expect much else for something insulated enough to keep your hands nice and toasty. Expensive but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan McKenna

customer_reviews.title: Burton Men's Gore-Tex Gloves
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I both ordered these gloves for 4 day ski trip, mine womens his mens. They are awesome, couldn't ask for better glove, the inner glove can be worn with or without outer glove. Made it very easy to snap photos on Iphone, very compatible with touch screen operation, and best of all we didn't have to freeze out hands off to get the pic. Wore then in -10 to 20 degree weather while it was snowing heavily (24" 1st day).
customer_reviews.author: Stacy P

customer_reviews.title: great gloves, bit larger than what I had expected
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit larger than what I would expected, if it does not fit your hands perfectly, the touch function will not work every time, make sure your hands fits perfectly otherwise everything else about these gloves are 5.0 stars
customer_reviews.author: leslie

customer_reviews.title: I had a pair of all black burton gore-tex gloves ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of all black burton gore-tex gloves and it lasted me through 4 seasons. It just starting showing signs of cracking through the barrier, so I picked these up.
customer_reviews.author: Larry L.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for. Both parts fit ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Both parts fit well and the interior glove option provides the flexibility for added warmth (if needed).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from the Burton Baker 2-1 glove to this Gore Tex version. I personally don't prefer the liners in gloves so I don't use them, just like I didn't with the Bakers. These stay plenty warm without the liners. A large fits my hand comfortably with out the liners, if I used the liners I would have gotten an XL. Overall Great Quality gloves. My Bakers held up for 4-5 seasons so I'm curious how long these will last.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Marquardt

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Well made glove, worth the money. After my wife gave me a set of these, I enjoyed them so much that I have since given them as gifts to family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Rob930

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: I used them for a week doing snowboarding. My hands were always dry, except for my perspiration. Excelent product! And the glove inside works perfectly with the iphone

customer_reviews.text: bought these for my pops. he's a tough blue collar dad with massive sausage fingers and they fit him well.

customer_reviews.title: Will keep you warm
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my husband. He loves them. Super warm. Like that it is two gloves in one.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality!
customer_reviews.text: Great brand and quality. Perfect for snow and cold weather activities.

customer_reviews.title: I liked the idea of the liner though so they can ...
customer_reviews.text: These were plenty warm but fit kind of weird with the liner. I liked the idea of the liner though so they can be cleaned so not bad.

customer_reviews.title: Great winter gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Great winter gloves. Fits great and hands do not sweat. The warmest gloves I own.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Would highly recommend them to anyone in need of a good waterproof ...
customer_reviews.text: These gloves worked well in both cold (15 degrees F) and in spring conditions (40-55 degrees) without the liners. Would highly recommend them to anyone in need of a good waterproof pair.
customer_reviews.author: Cmrodrvr

customer_reviews.title: I haven't used tehm yet, anyway I put them ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used tehm yet, anyway I put them under water and it is really waterproof, they fit well, they feel warm, I recomen them
customer_reviews.author: Jonatan Mucaled

customer_reviews.title: The vent/ heater pockect seems like a nice addition to get just the right temp
customer_reviews.text: Waterproof, warm and well made. Both the outer and inner gloves arrived. Both function as expected. The vent/ heater pockect seems like a nice addition to get just the right temp./moisture management. I ordered the biggest size, and I still cant get the outer glove over the liners on my big hands. I wish the wrist opening was a little larger to make getting them on easier. Their weather protection is great. Seem rugged so far. Other than the biggest size not being big enough for me, they are great.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent gloves. Worked wonders in very cold and snowy conditions
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A little big without the inserts. Fits perfectly with them.

customer_reviews.title: Discrepancies
customer_reviews.text: Just smaller than you would expect with the liner glove, plus it's not touchscreen gloves as the warmer inner Kaye.

customer_reviews.text: Nice gloves. Didn't keep my hands warm but I have Raynauds and almost nothing does. Oh well.

customer_reviews.text: Too small, and they don't have any kind of gauntlet. Too much money for a chintzy glove...

With that in mind, pros choose the bestselling Burton GORE-TEX� Under Glove.
